intro: Elatostema pachypodum, commonly known as the thick-stemmed elatostema, is a species of flowering plant in the family Melastomataceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its short, thick stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces clusters of small, white or pink flowers that bloom throughout the wet season. Elatostema pachypodum is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
